Class CarDataAnalysis

java.lang.Object
CarDataAnalysis
public class CarDataAnalysis extends Object
Car Data Analysis: Project 3 Starter Code. Allows user to input files of their choosing containing data regarding cars' brands, prices, years, and mileages, and the program can perform multiple types of analyses on the inputted data set which be outputted to any file of the user's choosing. Gateway Programming: Java Johns Hopkins University Fall 2022

    • printAveragePrice

      public static void printAveragePrice​(String brand, double avgPrice, int entries)
      Prints average price of the cars of the specified brand.
      Parameters:
      brand - the brand of car which's average is being taken.
      avgPrice - the average price of the cars of the specified brand.
      entries - the number of times a car of the specified appears within the data.

    • averagePrice

      public static void averagePrice​(String brU, String file, String[] b, String[] y, String[] p, String[] m) throws FileNotFoundException
      Calculates the average price of the cars of the specified brand.
      Parameters:
      brU - the brand of cars that wants to be analyzed.
      file - the file that the brands' info is to be printed to.
      b - the array containing all brands in the data set.
      y - the array containing all years in the data set.
      p - the array containing all prices in the data set.
      m - the array containing all mileages in the data set.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException

    • twoHighestPrices

      public static double[] twoHighestPrices​(String[] p)
      Finds the two highest prices within the entered data set.
      Parameters:
      p - the array conatining all of the prices within the data set
      Returns:
      maxes an array of size 2 containing the max prices.

    • averagePriceInRange

      public static void averagePriceInRange​(int yLow, int yHigh, double mLow, double mHigh, String[] y, String[] p, String[] m)
      Finds average price of cars within the given year and mileage ranges.
      Parameters:
      yLow - the lowest year within the specified range.
      yHigh - the highest year within the specified range.
      mLow - the lowest year within the specified range.
      mHigh - the highest year within the specified range.
      y - the array containing all years in the data set.
      p - the array containing all prices in the data set.
      m - the array containing all mileages in the data set.

    • bestValue

      public static void bestValue​(double mThresh, double pThresh, String[] b, String[] y, String[] p, String[] m)
      Finds the car with the best value with a mileage and price above the specified threshold.
      Parameters:
      mThresh - the lowest mileage accepted.
      pThresh - the lowest pice accepted.
      b - the array containing all brands in the data set.
      y - the array containing all years in the data set.
      p - the array containing all prices in the data set.
      m - the array containing all mileages in the data set.
